alert.note: Alert for Greene (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 23 at 9:59PM CDT until September 24 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM CDT SUNDAY FOR GREENE COUNTY... At 959 PM CDT, Emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain and flooding across the warned area. Multiple water rescues are ongoing across the city of Springfield. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Springfield, Republic, Battlefield, Strafford, Willard, Ash Grove, Brookline, Glidewell, Ebenezer, Galloway, Bois D`arc, Cave Springs, Turners and Bassville. This includes the following low water crossings... Wilson`s Creek at Farm Road 150, Sac River at County Road 1247, Clear Creek at Farm Road 87, Wilson Creek at Farm Road 156 and Wilson Creek at Farm Road 146. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
